storyInfo: The ideological conflict between the Sarkaz of Kazdel finally escalates beyond control. Theresa leaves Kazdel with her supporters.

attributes.content: The nomadic city of Kazdel, Kazdel
Let me through!
attributes.name: Odda

attributes.content: This area is off-limits.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Royal Court Soldier

attributes.content: What happened?
attributes.name: Odda

attributes.content: Are you with Babel?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Royal Court Soldier

attributes.content: N-No.
attributes.name: Odda

attributes.content: Then it's none of your business.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Royal Court Soldier

attributes.content: The wall of Royal Court soldiers prevents Odda from passing.
But he sees several familiar, crying faces in the scattering crowd.
Those students? Hm... I think I can take this alley here...
attributes.name: Odda

attributes.content: Excuse me, do you know what happened?
attributes.name: Odda

attributes.content: Someone beat another guy to death. He's dead, too. Are you trying to join the racket?
attributes.name: Indifferent Civilian

attributes.content: Babel again. What is Her Highness thinking?
attributes.name: Angry Civilian

attributes.content: Shut your trap. You owe everything you eat, everything you wear, and the roof over your head to Her Highness.
attributes.name: Indifferent Civilian

attributes.content: Shh...
attributes.name: Cautious Civilian

attributes.content: Well, it's simple enough alright! A teacher beat the father of his student to death!
attributes.name: Angry Civilian

attributes.content: A Teacher? How could...?
attributes.name: Odda

attributes.content: All the man did was scold him a little! And it was the teacher who was telling the kids all sorts of awful things!
attributes.name: Angry Civilian

attributes.content: That's not true...
attributes.name: Odda

attributes.content: You're a Babel shill too? Kids these days...
attributes.name: Scornful Civilian

attributes.content: Hey, what are you doing?
attributes.name: Scornful Civilian

attributes.content: Odda squeezes through the crowd and sees some familiar faces lying on the ground.
He finally finds the source of the commotion, the 'Teacher' lying in a cloud of dust.
Teacher! What's going on?
attributes.name: Odda

attributes.content: I... I didn't mean to hurt... his father...
attributes.name: 'Teacher'

attributes.content: Hang in there! I'll find a doctor!
attributes.name: Odda

attributes.content: No... over there... him...
attributes.name: 'Teacher'

attributes.content: Odda looks in the direction that the dying man is pointing, and sees an injured child crying by the lifeless body of his father.
Odda runs through the burning streets, carrying the injured child in his arms, and pieces together the whole picture from what he sees and hears.
It began when an agitated teacher accidentally killed an agitated father, before he was set upon by the angry crowd and fell in the dust of the streets.
The turmoil dragged everyone in: Civilians, Babel, mercenaries, even the Military Commission.
Like a chain reaction, clouds of dust were stirred up in various corners of the city.
It wasn't until artillery from an unknown source blasted through a wall of Babel's office building that the Royal Court troops finally quelled the riot.
It began with an accident and ended with a shell that caused more damage to Babel than anything in the past eighteen years, since the end of the war.
The kid is hurt and needs a doctor. Don't make me do this the hard way.
attributes.name: Odda

attributes.content: Whose side are you on? Babel? The Military Commission?
attributes.name: Dour Mercenary

attributes.content: Neither! I just need to get him to a doctor. Now get out of my way!
attributes.name: Odda

attributes.content: My dad...
attributes.name: Weakened Child

attributes.content: It's too late for him... I'm sorry.
attributes.name: Odda

attributes.content: Go. But don't trust outsiders so easily... Sarkaz. Not in this chaos.
attributes.name: Dour Mercenary

attributes.content: Thank you...
attributes.name: Odda

attributes.content: Odda can feel the child's breathing grow weaker as he continues on his way.
Running through the streets, he seems to feel someone brush past his shoulder, but sees no one.
Was I imagining things?
attributes.name: Odda

attributes.content: Stop right there! Not one step closer. There are patients inside.
attributes.name: Babel Member

attributes.content: This kid needs medical attention, now!
attributes.name: Odda

attributes.content: But... oh... I didn't think there was anyone still willing to bring patients here.
attributes.name: Babel Member

attributes.content: Alright, I'll take it from here. I'll try to give you some extra medicine before we leave.
attributes.name: Babel Member

attributes.content: Leave?
attributes.name: Odda

attributes.content: Her Highness made the decision, but we all know what's happening. We're not welcome in Kazdel anymore.
attributes.name: Babel Member

attributes.content: Where are you going? Outside the city? Aren't you afraid of the dangers in the wastes?
attributes.name: Odda

attributes.content: ...Yes, I am.
attributes.name: Babel Member

attributes.content: But if this city no longer welcomes us, then we respect its choice.
attributes.name: Babel Member

attributes.content: I want to join Babel. I can help care for the patients, or protect you.
attributes.name: Odda

attributes.content: Is this the one who started the whole mess? Will he live?
attributes.name: Indifferent Royal Court Soldier

attributes.content: Don't think so. Lost too much blood.
attributes.name: Tired Royal Court Soldier

attributes.content: Then what are we even doing here?
attributes.name: Indifferent Royal Court Soldier

attributes.content: Just follow the General's orders and don't ask questions. Who'd have thought something so minor would need Their Highnesses' statement?
attributes.name: Tired Royal Court Soldier

attributes.content: Ugh...
attributes.name: 'Teacher'

attributes.content: Is he trying to talk to us? There's nobody else around.
attributes.name: Tired Royal Court Soldier

attributes.content: Probably just seeing things before he dies. No Banshee would sing an elegy for such a sinner.
attributes.name: Indifferent Royal Court Soldier

attributes.content: It's... dangerous...
attributes.name: 'Teacher'

attributes.content: Go...
attributes.name: 'Teacher'

attributes.content: They can't see me. My Arts hide my presence.
attributes.name: Young Banshee

attributes.content: Who... are... you...?
attributes.name: 'Teacher'

attributes.content: A student.
attributes.name: Young Banshee

attributes.content: I came from far away, following in the footsteps of my mother, to find answers in this wandering city, and her two rulers.
attributes.name: Young Banshee

attributes.content: Did you... find...?
attributes.name: 'Teacher'

attributes.content: I'm afraid the city doesn't have the answers ready yet.
attributes.name: Young Banshee

attributes.content: But I found you. The ideas that you advocated were very interesting.
attributes.name: Young Banshee

attributes.content: I was with you when you taught those children in that basement, learning about the city and Babel.
attributes.name: Young Banshee

attributes.content: Of course, no one noticed... except Ascalon.
attributes.name: Young Banshee

attributes.content: The... boy...
attributes.name: 'Teacher'

attributes.content: Has been brought to Babel where his injuries will be treated.
attributes.name: Young Banshee

attributes.content: Do you regret your end?
attributes.name: Young Banshee

attributes.content: No... the boy defended me...
attributes.name: 'Teacher'

attributes.content: He understood... what I tried to change...
attributes.name: 'Teacher'

attributes.content: I'm sorry... about his father...
attributes.name: 'Teacher'

attributes.content: I sympathize. It was not your intention to cause this tragedy, but fate has played a cruel joke on you.
attributes.name: Young Banshee

attributes.content: I hear... crying...
attributes.name: 'Teacher'

attributes.content: It is your elegy, calling your fading soul to the other side.
attributes.name: Young Banshee

attributes.content: Fear not, hesitate not. The myriad souls welcome you with open arms. Let my song take you beyond.
attributes.name: Young Banshee

attributes.content: Thank you...
attributes.name: 'Teacher'

attributes.content: The young Banshee's song soothes the mind of the dying man.
The gentle song echoes through the crowded streets of the city. Banshees respond to the song of their young kin, adding their voices to the harmony.
It is an elegy that commemorates the passing of an ordinary Sarkaz.
'You were talking about the future of Babel in the lesson, but you didn't get to the end. What were you going to say?'
'I believe... that Babel will die someday. I hope I'm wrong.'
A song. Another Sarkaz has passed on in the turmoil.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: There is no longer any place for Babel here. I will lead them and leave this city.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Theresa... we love you, all of us...
attributes.name: Laqeramaline

attributes.content: I know. But Babel has no choice.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: But if you leave...
attributes.name: Laqeramaline

attributes.content: My people have made their choice. Neither I nor Theresis can change it.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: We cannot abandon hope. But the best course of action, right now, is to avoid conflict.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: ...Hatred will swallow us like a flood.
attributes.name: Laqeramaline

attributes.content: You've always known... Theresa, our hero, our King.
attributes.name: Laqeramaline

attributes.content: Gentle requests and gradual changes will not sway the minds of the Sarkaz drawn here by Kazdel's rise.
attributes.name: Laqeramaline

attributes.content: Laqeramaline, I...
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Perhaps what I say will disappoint, even hurt you, Theresa.
attributes.name: Laqeramaline

attributes.content: Rim Billiton, Sargon, even Columbia... you have opened their doors, and allowed the Sarkaz to negotiate with some as equals.
attributes.name: Laqeramaline

attributes.content: Terra has seen more technological progress in fifty years than it has for millennia.
attributes.name: Laqeramaline

attributes.content: ...But we were too slow. Despite the incredible changes you've brought to Kazdel, they haven't been enough to bear the fruits of true transformation.
attributes.name: Laqeramaline

attributes.content: Even if I, too, believe that the fruits of spring are near.
attributes.name: Laqeramaline

attributes.content: Is this the stance of the Banshee Court, Laqeramaline?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: I'm just a mother who came to see her boy off, Theresa.
attributes.name: Laqeramaline

attributes.content: I respect his choice, and there will come a day when he will speak for our Royal Court.
attributes.name: Laqeramaline

attributes.content: But that day is not today.
attributes.name: Laqeramaline

attributes.content: I know you love him... you haven't allowed yourself to age since he was born.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Aefanyl was a miracle to me, and to all Banshees.
attributes.name: Laqeramaline

attributes.content: The day he was born, I became loath to age with time.
attributes.name: Laqeramaline

attributes.content: I have preserved my appearance at the peak of my beauty... I wish to remain eternal in his memory.
attributes.name: Laqeramaline

attributes.content: My life is finite, of course. It's only the facade that never changes.
attributes.name: Laqeramaline

attributes.content: I know what Your Highness is thinking.
attributes.name: Laqeramaline

attributes.content: You never expected your dream to come true in this generation. You see yourself as the soil, and it's not the soil's due to witness the flowers bloom.
attributes.name: Laqeramaline

attributes.content: Even if the two of you have to give everything to nourish this soil...
attributes.name: Laqeramaline

attributes.content: Humor my little self-indulgence, Your Highness.
attributes.name: Laqeramaline

attributes.content: Until he finds the answer he is seeking, allow him to travel between the two of you, to learn from both of you.
attributes.name: Laqeramaline

attributes.content: He will be the first sprout to emerge from the soil.
attributes.name: Laqeramaline

attributes.content: Bring Aefanyl. Take care of him. Protect him in my place.
attributes.name: Laqeramaline

attributes.content: I will, Laqeramaline, my friend.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Thank you.
attributes.name: Laqeramaline

attributes.content: No matter where you go, no matter what fate awaits either of you, the Banshee Court will sing both your elegies, and announce to all...
attributes.name: Laqeramaline

attributes.content: This is my promise. It is the most ancient and powerful of witchcrafts, my final parting gift to you.
attributes.name: Laqeramaline

attributes.content: Laqeramaline.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Will we meet again?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: I hope so.
attributes.name: Laqeramaline

attributes.content: Until next time, then. I look forward to the day that I can hear you sing in the mists of the Convallis.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Farewell, Your Highness. I'm afraid I must stay here and go no further.
attributes.name: Laqeramaline

attributes.content: Aefanyl will be part of your procession, after all... and I'm not ready to say goodbye to him yet.
attributes.name: Laqeramaline

attributes.content: Two days later
How long do you plan on standing there?
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: You came a little too early, if it's Theresa you're looking for.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: I didn't think you would have the courage to come to me, Ascalon.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Why?
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: Do you mean why wouldn't you have the courage to see me, or why I banished Babel?
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: You've seen Manfred?
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Yes.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: Did you do it?
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Not all the way.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: Good.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Now, remove yourself before you say something childish and naive. Not even Theresa would agree with you.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Or you could choose to stay. You don't have to explain yourself. Afterall, you never formally joined Babel.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Her Highness needs someone to protect her.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: She is more powerful than you think.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: And I agree with you even less, Master.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: I suppose I should take that as a no.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: You and Manfred are my best students, yet both of you have your fatal flaws.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Your talents in combat are peerless. But what do you truly believe in?
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Your Highness
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: Impatience.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: I said, what you truly believe in. Not me nor Theresa.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: You still don't know what you seek, do you?
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: To protect? That's just empty, self-deceptive sentimentality. When you're unsure of your path, you merely project your motivations onto vague ideals.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: I-I've thought about it carefully.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: Perhaps.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Then follow Theresa and protect her, but don't blindly adopt her ways. Think for yourself. Manfred found his answer long before you did.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: The next time we see each other...
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: ...Nevermind.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Go, Ascalon.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: There is nothing else for us to talk about now.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Ascalon falls to one knee, then turns to a mist that closes around Theresis.
The mist trembles and disperses, leaving behind only a stone knife in Theresis's hand.
He recalls the day that he snatched the blade from the child in the Catastrophe.
You were too cold to her, Theresis.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: It's a time of parting. You could have shared your mind with her. She has never been adept at expressing emotion.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: As her teacher, you're better than me at reaching the teenager side of her.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Do you really have no faith in her choice?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: She is welcome back at any time. Manfred remains too complacent in his training. He needs someone to challenge him, a goal to work towards.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: I'll tell her.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: I wish you would come back, too.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: I know.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: If we cannot resolve a minor conflict like this, the next one could escalate into a full-fledged civil war.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: If it comes to that, all we have dreamed of for a century will be for naught.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: If that day comes and if I have to... I'll kill you.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Babel is ready. We will leave with those who are willing to follow.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: You've always kept them close.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Yes. Because they need me.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: I need you, too. Kazdel needs its King.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: ...Theresis.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Our people have made their choice. The best course of action, for now at least, is for Babel to back down.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: I will continue to call the nourishing rain upon Kazdel, change the city's circumstances, and wait for hatred to subside.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: But...
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: If you become the greatest threat to the searching dreamers in this long and painstaking process, I will destroy you.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: So be it.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Mercenaries and Royal Court soldiers line the streets, holding back the restless crowd.

attributes.text: It was the King of Sarkaz who brought food and shelter.
\nIt was also the King of Sarkaz who allowed oppression and hatred to fester.

attributes.content: The Babel procession stretches as far as the eye can see, past the barricades formed by lines of Royal Court soldiers, past the disdainful crowd.
Theresis walks toward the crowd and stands with them.
He has left Theresa's side for the first time in two centuries.
We all know what we must face.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: I hope this will not be the last time we stand together.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: ...Will that day be far?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Not too far.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Theresa joins the silent procession. Their farewell to the city is soundless. Their path is one of hope.
Then, something occurs, enough to silence the restless onlookers and momentarily halt the procession.
The cursing and crying cease. Every eye turns to a single, poignant scene.
A mercenary steps out of the line to embrace his best friend in the procession.
No one can hear the whispers exchanged between the two friends by the ruins of Babel, but all are willing to wait and give them their moment of farewell.
A farewell between the people and their city, and between two peoples of the same blood.
A young Sarkaz, who has lost everyone he holds dear, walks in the procession without regret.
He remembers walking the same path, leaving the city in search of his parents with his older companion many years ago.
Dad, I believe that there has to be another way than war.
attributes.name: Odda

attributes.content: Mom, I know you believed in Babel because you hoped for a different way to live.
attributes.name: Odda

attributes.content: Goodbye, Mom, Dad.
attributes.name: Odda

attributes.content: Goodbye, home.
attributes.name: Odda

attributes.content: For Theresa's eyes only,
I have heard of what happened in Kazdel and share your sense of loss. The city holds special meaning to us all.
But Babel need not drift on the wastelands, for I have located the ship I previously mentioned in Rim Billiton.
The excavation went smoothly, and the ship's basic functions have been restored after two years of work.
It will carry the hopes of Babel into the future. Please wait for me, Theresa.
P.S.: I did find it on the ship.
A legacy that could bring upheaval to this land.
Given its importance, I feel it is crucial to discuss this matter with you in person.
With hope, Kal'tsit
